intro: Navarretia prolifera var. lutea, commonly known as the yellow navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California and Baja California. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces yellow or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Navarretia prolifera var. lutea is often found in coastal and inland areas, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
